intro: Prenanthes oyukludaghensis, commonly known as the Oyukludagh waterplantain, is a rare flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and spadix-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils along streambanks and wet meadows. It is distinguished by its small, clustered white flowers and is considered an important indicator species for wetland ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is classified as endangered.
